timeline.message: Fix test for primary key indexes

timeline.bodyText: How does this play with the below comment about "Fileformat has been bumped from 10 to 11."?
timeline.author: rorbech
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,3 +1,24 @@
+## 7.0.4 (YYYY-MM-DD)
+
+### Enhancements
+* None.
+
+### Fixes
+* In some cases a frozen Realm of the wrong version could be returned.
+* Upgrading files with string primary keys would result in a file where it was not possible to find the objects by primary key. ([Core issue #3893](https://github.com/realm/realm-core/pull/3893), since 7.0.0)
+
+### Compatibility
+* Realm Object Server: 3.23.1 or later.
+* File format: Generates Realms with format v10 (Reads and upgrades all previous formats from Realm Java 2.0 and later).

replies.bodyText: 2.0 is the release number which isn't associated with the file format number in any way.
replies.author: cmelchior

replies.bodyText: It wasn't the 2.0 but the File format: Generates Realms with format v10 I was questioning.
replies.author: rorbech
